pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw:
Thanks for the PR. 

Three questions:

1. Why is it targeted at default? I thought this only makes sense in Gazebo versions preceding 9.0.
1. The printed warning as stated here doesn't actually warn the user that he uses an effect-less function. What about changing to "are deprecated and have no effect. Use Link::SetForce()/Link::SetTorque() instead.\n"?
1. What about the Model::SetLinearAccel()/Model::SetAngularAccel()? If you'd change the target to other than default, these would also need to be handled (IMO).
content.html:
Thanks for the PR.

Three questions:

  1. Why is it targeted at default? I thought this only makes sense in Gazebo versions preceding 9.0.
  2. The printed warning as stated here doesn't actually warn the user that he uses an effect-less function. What about changing to "are deprecated and have no effect. Use Link::SetForce()/Link::SetTorque() instead.\n"?
  3. What about the Model::SetLinearAccel()/Model::SetAngularAccel()? If you'd change the target to other than default, these would also need to be handled (IMO).

pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw:
1. Oh, then I misunderstood what you meant. I thought additional warnings should be printed since the call to the functions has been commented out. Should this be targeted at gazebo 8, or at all versions preceding gazebo 9?
2. Same misunderstanding as (1): Thought that it should warn the user who doesn't pay too much attention to compiler warnings. Can add the additional info, after we clarify which branch(es) this should be targeted at.
3. They call Link::SetLinearAccel()/Link::SetAngularAccel() so I though printing two warnings is maybe a bit much. Can add it to model as well of course.

Anybody else, additional thoughts on this?
content.html:
1. Oh, then I misunderstood what you meant. I thought additional warnings should be printed since the call to the functions has been commented out. Should this be targeted at gazebo 8, or at all versions preceding gazebo 9?
  2. Same misunderstanding as (1): Thought that it should warn the user who doesn't pay too much attention to compiler warnings. Can add the additional info, after we clarify which branch(es) this should be targeted at.
  3. They call Link::SetLinearAccel()/Link::SetAngularAccel() so I though printing two warnings is maybe a bit much. Can add it to model as well of course.

Anybody else, additional thoughts on this?

pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw:
Well, both interpretations make sense. But I'd say that if somebody ignores compiler warnings, he has to be prepared to face some problems :)

For me, the best solution would be to add the warning about uselessness to all supported versions (7 and 8?) and also to default (to stress that it's not the "normal" deprecation because of refactoring).
content.html:
Well, both interpretations make sense. But I'd say that if somebody ignores compiler warnings, he has to be prepared to face some problems :)

For me, the best solution would be to add the warning about uselessness to all supported versions (7 and 8?) and also to default (to stress that it's not the "normal" deprecation because of refactoring).

pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw:
True, people should pay attention to compiler warnings, even though many probably don't pay enough attention ;)

So you mean we'll add it to gazebo 7-9?

I've changed the text and also added it to Model.cc, is that better? Once this is approved I can send the same PR to the other release branches too.
content.html:
True, people should pay attention to compiler warnings, even though many probably don't pay enough attention ;)

So you mean we'll add it to gazebo 7-9?

I've changed the text and also added it to Model.cc, is that better? Once this is approved I can send the same PR to the other release branches too.

pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw:
From my point of view, I'd do it in 7-9. But that's probably more a decision for Gazebo maintainers.

The `gzwarn`s in Model.cc should be outside the foreach loop, shouldn't they? And also the text should tell that `Model::SetLinearAccel` is deprecated, and not `Link::SetLinearAccel`.
content.html:
From my point of view, I'd do it in 7-9. But that's probably more a decision for Gazebo maintainers.

The gzwarns in Model.cc should be outside the foreach loop, shouldn't they? And also the text should tell that Model::SetLinearAccel is deprecated, and not Link::SetLinearAccel.

pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw: Sure, guess that would be nicer. Changed it accordingly.
content.html: Sure, guess that would be nicer. Changed it accordingly.

content.html: if they are being deprecated as of 9.0, I don't think we need to backport deprecation warnings to 7 or 8

pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw:
I think it's probably ok to remove the comments and the warning here, because:

1. The user didn't directly call the `Set*Accel` functions
1. The effect of setting acceleration to zero is still being fulfilled, through setting force
content.html:
I think it's probably ok to remove the comments and the warning here, because:

  1. The user didn't directly call the Set*Accel functions
  2. The effect of setting acceleration to zero is still being fulfilled, through setting force
